intro: Pycnosorus pleiocephalus, commonly known as the broad-leaved pycnosorus, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. It is native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere, particularly in Europe and Asia. The plant features a basal rosette of lanceolate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowering stems rise above the leaves, bearing clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Pycnosorus pleiocephalus is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
